divs: Sighting DetailsWas travelling north on Hwy PD when my wife and I saw what appeared to be a stationary orange light hovering in the sky. Stopped my vehicle along side the road to get a better view. When I got out of my vehicle the light was moving in a southerly direction and more or less parallel to the road I was on. It wasn't moving very fast but I observed shortly after it passed my position that the light just seemed to disappear. Not like it got so far away I couldn't see it anymore, but just disappeared. It was a single, spherical orange light. It wasn't very bright, but somewhat subdued. It didn't blink, but maybe pulsated slightly and didn't make any sound that I could hear. The whole incident from the first moment I saw the light until I lost sight of it was approximately 2 minutes. The exact location as determined by topographical mapping software is 42 degrees, 55.570 minutes N and 89 degrees, 31.689 minutes W. Elevation of that location is 899ft above sea level. Time of incident was 1:35 a.m., October 31, 2010. Skies were clear and many stars along with a large crescent moon were visible. Approximate temperature was 35 degrees Fahrenheit. I had no alcohol or narcotics in my system. I was not impaired in any way. My wife also witnessed the light. There were no other vehicles on the road that I noticed when the light was visible. I assume it was just a normal aircraft that I couldn't positively I.D. Because of the darkness and the angle of viewing I might have missed some features that would have given me a clue as to what it was. I'm not overly concerned of what I saw, just curious.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Paoli
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: Orange light in sky appeared stationary then started moving south then disappeared.
